It has been said many times that the Scottish education system is one of the best in the world - the author having experienced a fair bit of it - and regardless of whether this is true or not, it has certainly played a vital role in Scottish history. Burke and Hare, the infamous body snatchers of Edinburgh, sold the bodies on to a local medical school. Today, education is a devolved power in Scotland, meaning that the Scottish government exercises total authority over the curriculum. Given that people in the EU (though not in the UK, for some strange reason) do not pay tuition fees for attending universities and colleges in Scotland, a lot of people have decided to come to Scotland to study. The Royal Society of Edinburgh is among one of the most prominent places for the learned, given its history of success - it has been noted for its advancement in philosophy, medicines, sciences, and the arts, making it, among other places like it within Scotland, part of the country’s intellectual greatness.

A new form of cooking has been invented in {1_City} - deep-frying! It is said that everything from chickens to candies to Natan's boots can be deep-fried and that the resulting taste is simply orgasmic!

A plot involving gunpowder to have us assassinated has been foiled! The plot involved a group of conspirators discontent with our religious policies, who aimed to have us ousted to suit their own selfish ends. A number of plotters perished in an effort to flee the capital, but the remainder shall be sentenced to death for their treason. The people will rejoice that their sovereign is safe.[NEWLINE]
Thank God the plot was foiled in time.

Adam Smith, economic and moral philosopher, has conceived his greatest work yet: An Inquiry into the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations. The book offers a unique insight into the inner workings of the economy, and examines such topics as the division of labour, productivity, and the free market. It will surely lend to us crucial knowledge in how to prosper our nation.[NEWLINE]

By the Gods! A fabled Wild Haggis - the most fearsome beast to roam the Scottish highlands - has appeared before us whilst out on a stroll through the countryside. Scholars had disparaged us for believing in such a creature - but behold! Evidence before our very eyes. We must make haste to capture it![NEWLINE]
We must run clockwise after it!
